page.title: 17TOURISM GOLDEN HILL FORT
page.content: The outside of the fort is whitewashed and on the inside it is made of brick. It was built between 1865 and 1869 and is now used as a museum. There is a prisoners cell on view with a hatch where food was passed through and the only light came through a barred window. On the top of the fort,40lb guns were placed in each corner and the soldiers lived in the barrack rooms. The fort is hexagonal in shape and from the top is a very good view of Freshwater,Totland and Yarmouth. The fort was re-opened in May 1985,as an art and craft centre with gift shops,blot-art work, woodwork,etc. on display.
